intro: Halodule beaudettei, commonly known as the Florida seagrass, is a species of marine flowering plant belonging to the family Posidoniaceae. It is characterized by its ribbon-like leaves and is typically found in shallow, tropical and subtropical coastal waters. This plant plays a vital role in marine ecosystems by stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms. It also contributes to carbon sequestration and water quality improvement in its environment. Halodule beaudettei is often found in association with other seagrass species in estuarine and coastal habitats.
